website_summaries.verdict: A ready-to-go solar generator that takes the hassle out of hooking up solar panels, but its battery life and charging speed are not on par with competitors.
pros: Replaceable battery is a nice plus
Extra solar panels can be connected, boosting its charging speed
cons: Slower to charge than other portable solar generators, taking 10+ hours (using only the built-in panel)
Battery only lasts a few hours with normal use, and power can bleed off when not being used
Rigid solar panel is prone to damage

customer_reviews.title: Immense help after Hurricane Maria
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this unit after hurricane Maria and it has been an immense help this past month. It's practically dummy proof, we power phones, tablets and can sleep at night with a fan (in the tropical heat). I am also able to run a load of laundry in a 170 watt portable washer!. It's also lightweight enough to take wherever I need to power something, so I don't worry about how to carry it up the stairs, so thumbs up. I also purchased the extra warranty but haven't heard anything from those guys after trying to contact them, so the jury is out on that part.
customer_reviews.author: organirrican

customer_reviews.title: Renogy Phoenix is better than expected
customer_reviews.text: Renogy Phoenix is better than expected. I bought it to help my parents in Puerto Rico following the aftermath of Maria, and it short after became a key piece of their survival kit. My dad suffers from sleep apnea, and the Phoenix helped him sleep well at night. I believe the Renogy Phoenix is very convenient given the fact that it provides multiple out ports and it provides power both in AC or DC format. Overall, it is not cheap generator but I recommend it, J. Moreno
customer_reviews.author: J. Moreno

customer_reviews.title: Missing Important Charging Cables
customer_reviews.text: I was really excited about this, but unfortunately, I am now very disheartened because of the 5 cables supposed to be in the box, there was only one. At first, I was wondering why there was such a big box for such a small cable, but when I read the instructions, I realized that 4 cables were missing. I am returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy M

customer_reviews.title: No problems on the airplane, great for travelers with mobile power needs.
customer_reviews.text: This power briefcase is great for people on the move with camera gear, drones, laptops, or other personal electronics. With (4) USB charging ports, abundant expansion for DC devices & charging sources, and True Sine AC power for sensitive devices. Could use a larger inverter than the 150 watts supplied, but otherwise an extremely useful unit. We were able to take it on the airplane where it was treated by TSA just like a standard laptop. You will not be disappointed in the build quality, feel, & functionality of this device.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary D.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent generator
customer_reviews.text: We are grateful to have this generator for our boat dock and on the boat. We use it for back up and it is very handy!! Great starter product for those learning about solar power . I also like that I can add a 100 watt panel to the system. Works great! Well made ! Easy to use! I do wish the cords came with a carry bag.
customer_reviews.author: catherine g white

customer_reviews.title: You will love this.
customer_reviews.text: This was used for a 12 day camping trip. We used it for charging tablets, Kindles, Ipods and a speaker for three people. At the end of two weeks it was down to 48% power. I did charge it for a few hours here and their. I will get the additional panel for future trips. Not sure I need it, but I like to be prepared.
customer_reviews.author: Bufford 122

customer_reviews.title: Would not charge anything except a phone/tablet
customer_reviews.text: I bought this, and mine may have been a dud. So promptly returned. Here's my experience. Looks good, would be great if worked as advertised. I fully charged the unit, and attempted to run/charge a 60w laptop. Did not work on the 120w outlet. Tried 4 different laptops with range from 35w to 90w, none would charge. The only thing that would charger were Ipad and cell phone. Again my unit may have been a dud. Too pricey to keep just to power two little devices, needed it for laptop.
customer_reviews.author: CryptoGuy

customer_reviews.title: Issues with recharging the unit!!
customer_reviews.text: I had an issue with the product for taking too long with recharging under direct sun light, the product looks and feels great!! and does charge your Cell phones and any other portable devices, but when recharging the unit itself for the following use it failed to deliver!! It only recharged like 15% after being exposed to direct sun light for about 8 hrs.
customer_reviews.author: Jesus

customer_reviews.title: Let me start this off with I love my PHOENIX
customer_reviews.text: Let me start this off with I love my PHOENIX!! Now I can go anywhere and charge up all my electronics. I'm always on my computer and I fly a drone every weekend and this solar generator (PHOENIX) will make my life much easier. Thank you so much for coming up with such a brilliant device. I recommend this to everybody that is on the go. Thanks again.
customer_reviews.author: jim paulson

customer_reviews.title: Worth it. Convenient. Light weight.
customer_reviews.text: So far petty pleased. I do wish it would charge quicker on the car charger but that's really it. It was chilly in Yosemite at night last week so we took our electric blanket camping with us. We used the electric blanket on high for about 6 hours and the charge did go from 100% to 18%. Charges super quick on wall charger and moderately fast in full sun. Partial shade (like Yosemite Valley) is kinda slow.
customer_reviews.author: Jk2003

customer_reviews.title: Great Design and Form Factor
customer_reviews.text: As advertised with good documentation. Even though there were cheaper alternatives out there, this one covered all the bases in a clean form factor. Most basic hookup cables are included, which is nice. My only gripe this early on is that I wish there were a built-in compartment to store cables along with the unit. As it is, I've kept the original packaging (which also has a handle on it) in order to keep the cables in one place with the charging unit. Not a big enough gripe to subtract a star. Overall, this will make a very nice long-term companion to any RV or bug-out kit!
customer_reviews.author: Letalis

customer_reviews.title: Eh
customer_reviews.text: When it works, it works well. Within two months of purchase, the battery management system failed and I had to mail the unit in for repairs which was fully covered. After another three months, the LCD screen has failed and I have to reach out again to see if it will be covered. For something this pricey, I would've thought the quality would be better.
customer_reviews.author: Max

customer_reviews.title: This thing is ridiculously versatile and durable
customer_reviews.text: I live off grid in the desert and have owned this unit for a year. I took it on a 3000 mile bike trip across the country before using it off grid full time. It is still working after dropping it from my moving bike several times, getting it wet, and using it in 125+ degree temperatures in the desert. This thing won't die! Has inputs for 100w additional solar panels, AC charger, 12v, DC. Outputs 110AC, 12vdc, 4 usb. I run laptops, dremel, full size oscillating fan, hair clippers, lights and more from this unit. I also use it to charge my electric bike!
customer_reviews.author: Luis Arana

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use & compact
customer_reviews.text: We have used it when our power went out to keep a light one with the built in flashlight! Its easy to plug and charge each month, and we like having the option to plug in my husband's BiPap machine to increase time of use should our power go out!
customer_reviews.author: Chandra L Compton

customer_reviews.title: Runs my outside fountain
customer_reviews.text: I don't know what I expected but the Renogy couldn't power many of my power tools as I was hoping to work with the tools outside my home. I have, however, learned to use it for charging my cellphone and my tablet. It can also run my electric water fountain all day on my patio. I'm still learning what it can do but I was disappointed when it couldn't run my toaster. I plan to order a panel and add 100 more volts (or is it watts? ) to my system. New bee at solar. I am however, staying with Renogy. Hope this helps.
customer_reviews.author: Wanda M Dennis

customer_reviews.title: excellent build quality
customer_reviews.text: the renogy phoenix portable generator arrived very nicely packaged and in perfect condition. It has a solid quality feel to it. i am still determining the best way to solar charge it. i have included a photo of it in my conference room window. the hope is that it will be able to supply the support i need to charge my drone in the field. will return and edit as i test these functions.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Making James Bond look like battery solar charger all in 1 so slick
customer_reviews.text: Just got this and oh boy, what can I say? This company got it right! Making James Bond look like battery solar charger all in 1 so slick, makes my day!!! Check out the looks as I am charging it for the first time... Can't wait to use this camping on my next trip! Seems well made!!!
customer_reviews.author: constzi

customer_reviews.title: Great Portable Generator for the Money
customer_reviews.text: What an awesome generator, got it last week and already have used it in the wild. Charged quickly, had lots of port selections and easily expandable. Overall I'm super satisfied with this portable generator as it how now enabled me to go literally anywhere without power concerns.
customer_reviews.author: PH

customer_reviews.title: Small form, physically sturdy/heavy, great charge life!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this on March 11, 2020. I just turned on this generator because I had charged it in March, and figured that it probably lost some of the charge since then. But no, the generator is still at 100%. The only other thing that holds a charge this well is my Segway MiniPro, but that's a different review LOL.
customer_reviews.author: Rose Collum

customer_reviews.title: Perfect and Constructed well.
customer_reviews.text: I love it, just what I needed, so far so good! I can charge my iPad pro and my Surface while using them which is perfect! I like the display, letting me know how much light I'm getting and how much its charged and its convenient to swtich from AC to DC or both, just with two buttons. The case is sturdy and solid and well constructed. This is a solid mobile solar station.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony T

customer_reviews.title: Amazing design and operation
customer_reviews.text: The quality of this product is outstanding. I have been charging it via the wall outlet option and testing its capabilities with multiple devices (laptops, iPhones and iPads) and all of them have charged from the built in battery without issues. Love the product and will definitely purchase some expansion panels for it.
customer_reviews.author: Hector Arenas

customer_reviews.title: I think it is slowww and I got a bad copy. Going to return it
customer_reviews.text: I have this for about a week. Tried to charge under sun ( Colorado ) ..in about 2 hrs it only charged 3% !!! I think it is slowww and I got a bad copy. Going to return it. This thing is not working and Amazon won't let me return it !! I am very disappointed for such a buy . I just hope the customer care contact me and give me some option. I can believe I wasted 600 USD for a lemon !!! Beware guys before buying this.
customer_reviews.author: Indie_jones

customer_reviews.title: Don’t take electricity for granted
customer_reviews.text: Funny how having a 2 day power failure makes you think about 21st century living and how to keep the basics functioning. For us it’s fridge TV and WiFi and a little light to get around. For fridge you need something kind of powerful for at least a few hours a day. I probably need a couple of these but next power failure will be the test
customer_reviews.author: Customer since 1999

customer_reviews.title: So far as advertised, solid
customer_reviews.text: Initial purchase, unboxed well. Solid construction and all versions of charging cable included unit came out of box at 48% charged. LED has low/high/SOS settings and is nice integrated feature.
customer_reviews.author: chellefrancis

customer_reviews.title: Get the Pheonix.  The Firefly is awesome, but this is a whole new level of cool.
customer_reviews.text: The Pheonix has everything the Firefly has, but in a more refined package and with a removable battery. The inverter and built in solar panels are low wattage, but it is expandable and extremely portable.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Curtis

customer_reviews.title: It worked great, and allowed me to communicate with him
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband when he was in the field to charge his phone and electric razor. It worked great, and allowed me to communicate with him. I highly recommend it, it is well made and appears to be high quality. It's well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A must have when you need power off the grid
customer_reviews.text: This is a great way to keep my laptop, tablet, dual band 2 way radio, water pump, cell phone, etc charged up when away from service power.
customer_reviews.author: Baja Boy

customer_reviews.title: Well thought out and very easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Great compact product to get off the grid for a weekend! I love how easy the ports are laid out- everything is clearly labeled and works without having to read a manual.
customer_reviews.author: Moises Esquenazi

customer_reviews.title: As advertised and more!
customer_reviews.text: The Renogy Phoenix came well packaged and it had no flaws. The instruction were clear and easy to follow. It has many different charging ports and ways to be charged. Renogy provided all the needed cables to do this, without having to buy separate cables. The case opens and closes crisply. This whole unit feels like it is built well and rugged. I cant wait to try it in the field.
customer_reviews.author: Russell M.

customer_reviews.title: Is the generator have cooling system in itself?
customer_reviews.text: This item is very good. It is very conveniently to use. But in my country (Thailand) it quite hard to find place for use solar to recharge the energy at noon. Because sunlight at noon is very hot, even temperature is not high at 40c (around 38c) but the heat that comulative from sunlight make the generator's temperature may over 60c. That make me feel uneasy to left it recharge it at noon. But all I can say is I'm very happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Wisanu Aroonsangsuree

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product. I have mine setup inside due to no outside space available. Works great even through window.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Sleek, Compact & Up to the Task
customer_reviews.text: The Phoenix was exactly the product I was both needing and imagining it would be. I needed something very mobile, compact and also expandable with an additional solar panel (also purchased the Renogy 100W panel set STCs-100D). It's solid, well-designed and easy to use right out of the box (full charge it first). I haven't yet maxed out its abilities but will update when I do. Very happy so far.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Darling, Traveler|Speaker|Mentor

customer_reviews.title: Dont Buy ....too fragile- ZERO parts or support
customer_reviews.text: Save your money. Mine broke at the lid hinge and the 800 number advised me to "...take it to a repair shop...." but could not give me the number or address of any such repair shops anywhere. Buy the R brand, I did. The Renology went to the recycling center
customer_reviews.author: Rob Axelson

customer_reviews.title: Cool, Compact Unit!
customer_reviews.text: Nice unit. That's what she said anyway. No complaints on quality/construction. Haven't added a secondary panel yet, but will soon. Charged in 95 degree sun and it alerted me when it got too hot for battery bank, but happy to know when it needed some shade. Good buy!
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: A real work horse
customer_reviews.text: It makes it possible when you need dual charging your drone and l.e.d. lighting for extended stays out at the same time Right out of the box its heavy but quite rugged for wear and tear of being in a ruck sack ; well built and thought out protective fold up external casing
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: A amazing product for all your power needs with convenience.
customer_reviews.text: A amazing product for all your power needs. We find it very useful to provide power to our presentation equipment when we are presenting in public areas. Thank you Renogy
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful backup system in case of a power outage.
customer_reviews.author: Alexa

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for use when camping in the woods not an RV campground. We use it to inflate our air mattress, plug in our phones, and like the fact we can charge it by solar or plug-in. Plan on getting a solar panel to go along with this product.
customer_reviews.author: HELEN

customer_reviews.title: So far I like it.
customer_reviews.text: So far I like it ... a lot. Seems well built and easy to use. I will update after I have more time with it but the initial impressions are positive.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Baker

customer_reviews.title: Shirt of amazing TBH
customer_reviews.text: I love it I use it for charging my phone and running a Green Waterless car detailing business.
customer_reviews.author: christopher

customer_reviews.title: Very good portable generator
customer_reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised with the built quality of the Renogy Phoenix Portable Generator. I have used it to charge some of my portable electronic devices and it has worked flawlessly..
customer_reviews.author: DSWAB

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: charges the power tools, fits in back pack or carry on.
customer_reviews.author: stan hunter

customer_reviews.title: Just Open It or Plug It In!
customer_reviews.text: My family and I use our Phoenix Generator when we vacation at our rustic, electricity-free, running water-free cottage in Ontario, Canada. Our cottage is a 20 minute boat ride and another 30 minute drive to the nearest town/conveniences. Having the back-up of the Phoenix has drastically eased our minds in the event of an inevitable emergency. Our Phoenix has proven to be durable, dependable and extremely user friendly. It is certainly a treat to be able to charge our phones, inflate air mattresses and use CPAP machines, without the guilt of harming the environment. I highly recommend this product to any nature enthusiast looking for a lightweight, powerful and clean way to stay charged!
customer_reviews.author: Liz G.

customer_reviews.title: Looks good so far
customer_reviews.text: I just received this item yesterday. It appears to work in the quick tests I did and it did not have any visible defects. The PV input cable that came with it appears to plug into to Renogy 100W solar panel I also purchased to go with it. If there were one improvement I would suggest is an integrated box (preferably removable) to store the cables that come with it. Since it is meant to be portable, this would help to keep all of the needed components together.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best thing to put. In your RV !!!!
customer_reviews.text: The best thing for a capa will run all nite and still have. Power for coffee in the morning love it !!!!
customer_reviews.author: jay bird

customer_reviews.title: I love this product
customer_reviews.text: I love this product. I have been building a product like this myself for years and for the price this is I can not make anything even close.
customer_reviews.author: Elaine Elmore

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to any prep kit...highly recommend it
customer_reviews.text: really like the unit. just got it today. very sturdy construction, came in well packed. when it arrived, it was charged to 25% and after few hours of charging, it was up and running. menu and instructions on care and maintenance that came with the unit are very clear. read it before using it, you will know how to utilize the unit properly, without over-loading it. I haven't had a chance to charge it via solar yet, that is my next step, but for now, I'm a very happy camper.
customer_reviews.author: Russell S.

customer_reviews.title: OK
customer_reviews.text: I like it, but it is heavier than I expected and the instructions are very poor.
customer_reviews.author: Lynne Alice Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the money
customer_reviews.text: Good backup power for cellphones, computers and lighting when the power goes out. Easy to understand instructions. Only downside is a lengthy recharge time using solar.
customer_reviews.author: Lightly Salted

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. Seems to be a sturdy built (switches
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Seems to be a sturdy built (switches, covers, handle, locking mechanism). Charged quickly. Lost 3% of power between charging and first use (approximately one week). Have had modem plugged in now for 45 minutes and has used 3% running it.
customer_reviews.author: I am single-handedly putting kids of AMZN execs through college

customer_reviews.title: Can't get a better solar generator
customer_reviews.text: Superb build quality, great product and great people. Top marks
customer_reviews.author: davidbryant

customer_reviews.title: It do as it said
customer_reviews.text: It does not do as it said and one piece was broken
customer_reviews.author: martha treants

product_meta.title: Renogy Phoenix 246.24Wh/150W Portable Generator All-in-one Kit with 20W Built-in Solar Panel for Outdoors Camping Travel Emergency Off-Grid Applications, 246Wh w, Black
product_meta.description: The Phoenix is an all-in-one portable solar power system specifically designed for mobile, off-grid applications, and is ideal for emergencies. This compact, lightweight back-up system combines two highly efficient Renogy 10W Monocrystalline Solar Panels and is capable of expanding up to 100 watts. The included 17. 1Ah Li-ion(NMC) battery is replaceable giving the capability of limitless power. The Phoenix is ideal for powering several on-the-go appliances during a weekend trip, or even in an emergency situation. Notice: Do not leave the Phoenix out in excessive heat (104°F +) for long periods of time doing so may cause the Phoenix to overheat.
feature_bullets: The Phoenix is an all-in-one portable solar power system specifically designed for mobile, off-grid applications and is ideal for emergencies
This compact, lightweight back-up system combines highly efficient Renogy 20W Mono-crystalline Solar panels and can expand up to 100 watts with additional paves
The Phoenix can be charged by solar, AC power, or car power and comes with a 17. 1Ah li-ion(neck) Battery
The included 17. 1Ah li-ion(neck) Battery, giving the capability of limitless power. Charging temperature range 045C°
Minimum inverter efficiency: 80 percentage, max Continuous Output power: 150W, Output AC Frequency: 60 Hz

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars151 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
